trans-unit.source: Describes a way to paint a region by using one or more tiles.
The derived classes of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> define the contents of the tiles that you use to paint a region.
For example, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.ImageBrush> class to paint an area by using an image.
Use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> to control how you paint an area.
For example, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] provides several types of brushes:
To paint by using an image, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.ImageBrush>.
To paint by drawing, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.DrawingBrush>.
To paint by using a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualBrush>.

When you use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> to paint an area, instead of painting an area by using a single stretched image, you can paint an area by using a series of image tiles that create a pattern.
When you paint an area by using a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush>, you use three components: content, tiles, and the output area.
The following illustrations show how these three <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> components relate to each other.
![TileBrush components](~/add/media/wcpsdk-mmgraphics-defaultcontentprojection2.png "TileBrush components")
Components of a TileBrush with a single tile
![Components of a tiled TileBrush](~/add/media/graphicsmm-tiledprojection.png "Components of a tiled TileBrush")
Components of a TileBrush with a TileMode of Tile
**Content**: A <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> can have different types of content:
If the brush is an <xref:System.Windows.Media.ImageBrush>, this content is an image.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.ImageBrush.ImageSource%2A> property specifies the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.ImageBrush>.
If the brush is a <xref:System.Windows.Media.DrawingBrush>, this content is a drawing.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.DrawingBrush.Drawing%2A> property specifies the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.DrawingBrush>.
If the brush is a <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualBrush>, this content is a visual.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualBrush.Visual%2A> property specifies the content of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualBrush>.
You can specify the position and dimensions of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> property.
**Tiles**: A <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> produces one or more tiles.
By default, the content of the brush is stretched to fill a single tile and that tile is stretched to fill the output area.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> property is used to specify the size and position of the base tile for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewportUnits%2A> property determines whether the size and position of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> are relative to the output area (the default behavior) or whether they are absolute values.

**Output Area**: The output area is the area that the brush paints, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape.Fill%2A> of an <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Ellipse> or the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Control.Background%2A> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>.

For more information about the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> class, see [Painting with Images, Drawings, and Visuals](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/painting-with-images-drawings-and-visuals.md) .
Freezable Features
A <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> is a <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> type.
For information about <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> features, such as freezing and cloning, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md).
Provides initialization for base class values when called by the constructor of a derived class.
Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of content in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> base tile.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.AlignmentX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.AlignmentY%2A> properties of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> are used when either of the following conditions is true:

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Stretch%2A> property is <xref:System.Windows.Media.Stretch.Uniform> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Stretch.UniformToFill> and the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> have different aspect ratios.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Stretch%2A> property is <xref:System.Windows.Media.Stretch.None> and the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> are different sizes.

Note that you specify the dimensions of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> property; you specify the position and size of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> base tile by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A value that specifies the horizontal position of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> content in its base tile.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment.Center"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.AlignmentX"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the vertical alignment of content in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> base tile.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.AlignmentX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.AlignmentY%2A> properties of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> are used when either of the following conditions are true:

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Stretch%2A> property is <xref:System.Windows.Media.Stretch.Uniform> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Stretch.UniformToFill> and the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> have different aspect ratios.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Stretch%2A> property is <xref:System.Windows.Media.Stretch.None> and the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> are different sizes.

Note that you specify the dimensions of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> property; you specify the position and size of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> base tile by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A value that specifies the vertical position of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> content in its base tile.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.AlignmentY.Center"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.AlignmentY"></xref> dependency property.
Creates a modifiable copy of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> by making deep copies of its values.
Use this method to produce modifiable copies of read-only <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects.
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
When this method copies dependency properties, it copies resource references and data bindings although they might no longer resolve.
It does not copy animations or their current values.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable deep copy of the current object.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property of the cloned object returns `false` even if the <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property of the source is `true.`
Creates a modifiable copy of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> object by making deep copies of its values.
This method does not copy resource references, data bindings, or animations, although it does copy their current values.
Use this method to produce modifiable copies of read-only <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects.
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable deep copy of the current object.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property of the cloned object is `false` even if the <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> prope-rty of the source is `true`.
Obtains the current bounds of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> content
The output bounds of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> content.
Gets or sets a value that specifies how the content of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> stretches to fit its tiles.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Stretch%2A> property accepts the following values, which the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Stretch> enumeration defines:
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Stretch.None>: The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content does not stretch to fill the tile.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Stretch.Uniform>: The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content is scaled to fit the tile dimensions.
However, the aspect ratio of the content is preserved.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Stretch.UniformToFill>: The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content is scaled so that it completely fills the output area but preserves its original aspect ratio.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Stretch.Fill>: The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content is scaled to fit the tile.
Because the content's height and width are scaled independently, the original aspect ratio of the content might not be preserved.
That is, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content might be distorted in order to completely fill the output tile.
The following image illustrates the different <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Stretch%2A> settings.
![Different TileBrush Stretch settings](~/add/media/img-mmgraphics-stretchenum.jpg "Different TileBrush Stretch settings")
Different stretch settings

Note that you specify the dimensions of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> property; you specify the position and size of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> base tile by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> property.
Viewbox Clipping
<xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> contents are never clipped to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A>.

However, <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> contents *are* clipped to the edges of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A>, which sets the dimensions for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> base tile.

The following illustration shows the effect of different <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Stretch%2A> settings on a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> that has a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> that is smaller than its <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A>.
The parts of the image that are outside the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> are tinted gray.
![TileBrush with different Stretch settings](~/add/media/graphicsmm-viewbox-clipping.png "TileBrush with different Stretch settings")
TileBrush with different Stretch settings
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A value that specifies how this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> content is projected onto its base tile.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Stretch.Fill"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Stretch"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that specifies how a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> fills the area that you are painting if the base tile is smaller than the output area.
The following illustration shows the different tile modes, which are defined by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileMode> enumeration.
![Different TileBrush TileMode settings](~/add/media/img-mmgraphics-tilemodes.gif "Different TileBrush TileMode settings")
Available tile modes for the TileMode enumeration

For the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.TileMode%2A> property to have an effect, you must set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> for the brush to a size that is smaller than the area that you are painting (the output area).

If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> size is equal to or exceeds the output area, the brush produces a single tile that expands to fill the output area, and no tile pattern occurs.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None

A value that specifies how the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> tiles fill the output area when the base tile, which is specified by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport"></xref> property, is smaller than the output area.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileMode.None"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.TileMode"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the position and dimensions of the content in a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> tile.
When you paint an area by using a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush>, you use three components: content, tiles, and the output area.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> property specifies the size and position of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content.
The following illustration shows how these three <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> components relate to each other.
![TileBrush components](~/add/media/wcpsdk-mmgraphics-defaultcontentprojection2.png "TileBrush components")
TileBrush components
![Components of a tiled TileBrush](~/add/media/graphicsmm-tiledprojection.png "Components of a tiled TileBrush")
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewboxUnits%2A> property determines whether the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> value is interpreted as a relative or absolute value.
By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewboxUnits%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode.RelativeToBoundingBox>.
Viewbox Clipping
<xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> contents are never clipped to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A>.
However, <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> contents *are* clipped to the edges of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A>, which sets the values for the base tile.

The following illustration shows the effect of different <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Stretch%2A> settings on a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> that has a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> that is smaller than its <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A>.
The parts of the image that are outside the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> are tinted gray.
![TileBrush with different Stretch settings](~/add/media/graphicsmm-viewbox-clipping.png "TileBrush with different Stretch settings")
TileBrush with different Stretch settings
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The position and dimensions of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> content.

The default value is a rectangle (<xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref>) that has a <xref href="System.Windows.Rect.TopLeft"></xref> of (0,0), and a <xref href="System.Windows.Rect.Width"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Rect.Height"></xref> of 1.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox"></xref> dependency property.

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox"></xref> value is relative to the bounding box of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> contents or whether the value is absolute.
A value of <xref:System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode.RelativeToBoundingBox> indicates that the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewboxUnits%2A> are relative to the bounding box of the content.
Note that a value of <xref:System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode.Absolute> specifies device independent pixels instead of device pixels, which are device dependent.
Therefore, when a value of <xref:System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode.Absolute> applies, each pixel represents 1/96th of an inch.

You must remember this pixel distinction when you specify the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> of an <xref:System.Windows.Media.ImageBrush> that has a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage> as its source.
For example, when you use the standard pixel as a measure, a 300 by 300 pixel image is only one inch in width if the image resolution is 300 dots per inch.
However, when you want to set an absolute value, you must set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> to (0, 0, 96, 96) in order to include the whole image.
You can specify the size and position of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewboxUnits%2A> property determines whether the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox%2A> value is relative to the bounds of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content or whether it is an absolute value.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None

A value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewbox"></xref> value is relative to the bounding box of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> contents or whether it is an absolute value.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode.RelativeToBoundingBox"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewboxUnits"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the position and dimensions of the base tile for a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref>.
When you paint an area by using a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush>, you use three components: content, tiles, and the output area.
The following illustration shows how these three <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> components relate to each other.
![TileBrush components](~/add/media/wcpsdk-mmgraphics-defaultcontentprojection2.png "TileBrush components")
Components of a TileBrush with a single tile
![Components of a tiled TileBrush](~/add/media/graphicsmm-tiledprojection.png "Components of a tiled TileBrush")
Components of a TileBrush with a TileMode of Tile
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> property determines the size and position of the tiles in a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush>.
By default, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> has a single tile that fills the whole output area.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Stretch%2A> property controls how the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content fits into that tile.
You can override this default behavior and specify the tile size by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> property.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewportUnits%2A> property to specify whether the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> uses absolute or relative coordinates.
If the coordinates are relative, they are relative to the size of the output area.
The point (0,0) represents the upper-left corner of the output area, and (1,1) represents the lower-right corner of the output area.

To specify that the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> property uses absolute coordinates, set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewportUnits%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode.Absolute>.

The following illustration shows the difference in output when you set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewportUnits%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> to either relative or absolute.
![Absolute and Relative Viewport Units](~/add/media/absolute-and-relative-viewports.png "Absolute and Relative Viewport Units")
Relative and absolute ViewportUnits
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The position and dimensions of the base tile for a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref>.

The default value is a rectangle (<xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref>) with a <xref href="System.Windows.Rect.TopLeft"></xref> of (0,0) and a <xref href="System.Windows.Rect.Width"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Rect.Height"></xref> of 1.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport"></xref> dependency property.

Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode"></xref> enumeration that specifies whether the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport"></xref>, which indicates the size and position of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> base tile, is relative to the size of the output area.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> property determines the size and position of the tiles in a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush>.
By default, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> has a single tile that fills the whole output area.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Stretch%2A> property controls how the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> content fits into that tile.
You can override this default behavior and specify the tile size by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> property.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewportUnits%2A> property to specify whether the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> uses absolute or relative coordinates.
If the coordinates are relative, they are relative to the size of the output area.
The point (0,0) represents the upper-left corner of the output area, and (1,1) represents the lower-right corner of the output area.

To specify that the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport%2A> property uses absolute coordinates, set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewportUnits%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode.Absolute>.

The following illustration shows the difference in output when you set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewportUnits%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> to either relative or absolute.
![Absolute and Relative Viewport Units](~/add/media/absolute-and-relative-viewports.png "Absolute and Relative Viewport Units")
Relative and absolute ViewportUnits
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None

Indicates whether the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.Viewport"></xref>, which describes the size and position of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref> tiles, is relative to the size of the whole output area.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BrushMappingMode.RelativeToBoundingBox"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush.ViewportUnits"></xref> dependency property.
